function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Poor hospital architecture facilitating disease spread","Impact":"Increased risk of disease outbreaks and higher transmission rates","Mitigation":"Implementing infection control measures in architectural design, improving ventilation systems, and separating high-risk areas","Technologies":"Advanced ventilation systems, air purification technologies, and smart building designs","People":"Patients, healthcare workers, visitors","Owner":"Architects, healthcare facility management"},{"Description":"Lack of integration of infection prevention in sustainable designs","Impact":"Failure to effectively prevent and control communicable infections within health facilities","Mitigation":"Integrating infection prevention methods into sustainable design principles, implementing advanced cleaning and disinfection technologies","Technologies":"Green building materials, UV disinfection systems, antimicrobial surfaces","People":"Patients, healthcare workers, visitors","Owner":"Architects, sustainability experts, healthcare facility management"},{"Description":"Inadequate adaptation to emerging problems and urgent demands","Impact":"Inability to effectively respond to sudden increases in patient load, leading to overwhelmed healthcare facilities","Mitigation":"Implementing flexible design concepts, modular structures, and adaptive infrastructure for rapid expansion","Technologies":"Modular building systems, smart sensors for facility monitoring, telemedicine technologies","People":"Healthcare workers, facility management, emergency response teams","Owner":"Architects, facility management, healthcare administrators"}]}
